geneVariantDescriptions.description: HEY1 over exp indicates an over expression of the Hey1 protein. However, the mechanism causing the over expression is unspecified.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a clinical study, HEY1, HES1 and SOX9 over expression demonstrated an additive increase in the risk of death in colorectal cancer patients treated with Adrucil (fluorouracil) chemotherapy, but not untreated patients (PMID: 23900217).

references.title: Notch-induced transcription factors are predictive of survival and 5-fluorouracil response in colorectal cancer patients.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a clinical study, HEY1 over expression correlated with poor outcome in colorectal cancer patient (PMID: 23900217).

references.title: Notch-induced transcription factors are predictive of survival and 5-fluorouracil response in colorectal cancer patients.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, GANT61 did not inhibit growth of primary liver cancer cells over expressing target genes of the Notch (HES1, HEY1, TRIB2, NOTCH3, CCND1) and Hedgehog (GLI1, GLI2) pathways in culture (PMID: 27103434).

references.title: The inhibition of Akt-Pdpk1 interaction efficiently suppresses the growth of murine primary liver tumor cells.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, LY3039478 and NSC156529 combination treatment resulted in improved growth inhibition over single drug treatment in primary liver cancer cells over expressing target genes of the Notch (HES1, HEY1, TRIB2, NOTCH3, CCND1) and Hedgehog (GLI1, GLI2) pathways in culture (PMID: 27103434).
